author: Special Correspondent
text: Madurai City police on Wednesday arrested Madurai-based advocate W. Peter Ramesh Kumar, who was convicted for six months by a Special Bench of the Madras High Court in February for committing a criminal contempt of court. The police arrested him based on an order from the High Court, said Madurai Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav. Pudur Inspector of Police G. Chakravarthy arrested him at his house in Valar Nagar here around 8 p.m., police sources said. The High Court had taken suo motu contempt proceedings against Ramesh Kumar on a charge of interrupting the proceedings of a Division Bench at the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court on September 16, 2015. He was also charged with inciting advocates to boycott the court in support of some lawyers who were arrested for staging a sit-in protest in the Chief Justice’s court hall.
title: Madurai advocate held for criminal contempt of court
